question_stem.en: {{exhibit_1}}A sixty-eight-year-old man is evaluated for visual loss in the left eye that resolved spontaneously within several hours. {{exhibit_2}}The patient has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, coronary artery disease, and ischemic cardiomyopathy. {{exhibit_3}}He has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 40 years. {{exhibit_4}}Physical examination reveals a left carotid bruit but no neurologic deficits. {{exhibit_5}}A carotid duplex ultrasound shows 85% stenosis of the left internal carotid artery, and carotid angiography with stenting is performed. During the procedure, atherosclerotic debris embolize to the artery shown (white arrow) on the cerebral magnetic resonance angiogram below.
question_stem.zh: {{exhibit_1}}一名68岁男性因左眼视力丧失而就诊，该症状在数小时内自发缓解。{{exhibit_2}}患者有高血压、2型糖尿病、冠心病和缺血性心肌病的病史。{{exhibit_3}}他过去40年来每天吸一包香烟。{{exhibit_4}}体格检查显示左侧颈动脉杂音，但无神经功能缺损。{{exhibit_5}}颈动脉超声检查显示左侧颈内动脉狭窄85%，并进行了颈动脉血管造影和支架置入术。在手术过程中，动脉粥样硬化碎片栓塞至下图所示的动脉（白箭头），图为脑磁共振血管造影。 (Chinese translation)

question.en: Which of the following actions is most likely to be impaired in this patient as a result of the embolization?
question.zh: 由于栓塞，该患者最有可能损害以下哪种行为？

explanation.en:
This cerebral magnetic resonance angiogram shows a 3D reconstruction of the circle of Willis, with the top representing superior regions and the bottom representing inferior regions. The internal carotid arteries are the large vessels seen bilaterally near the center of the image. Each gives off a middle cerebral artery to supply lateral brain regions and an anterior cerebral artery, which extends medially and then superiorly. Each anterior cerebral artery supplies the medial region of the ipsilateral hemisphere, from the frontal pole to the parietooccipital sulcus.

Occlusion of the anterior cerebral artery would affect sensory and motor function of the contralateral leg and foot while predominantly sparing the contralateral arm/face (cortical homunculus). Patients with contralateral anterior cerebral artery occlusion can also develop significant behavioral symptoms (eg, abulia) and urinary incontinence if the frontal micturition center (eg, medial frontal lobe/cingulate gyrus) is affected.

(Choices B, C, D, and E) Occlusion of the middle cerebral artery would affect motor control of the hand (eg, gripping), face/mouth (eg, whistling), and throat (eg, swallowing) out of proportion to the leg. It can also result in Broca aphasia (due to damage of the dominant frontal lobe), anosognosia and spatial neglect of the contralateral side (due to damage of the nondominant parietal lobe), conjugate gaze deviation toward the side of the stroke, and contralateral homonymous hemianopsia (due to damage of the optic radiations in the subcortical temporoparietal lobe).

Educational objective:
The anterior cerebral arteries supply the medial portions of the 2 hemispheres (frontal and parietal lobes). Occlusion can cause contralateral motor and sensory deficits of the lower extremities, behavioral changes, and urinary incontinence.
explanation.zh:
该脑磁共振血管造影显示了Willis环的3D重建，顶部代表上部区域，底部代表下部区域。颈内动脉是图像中心附近双侧可见的大血管。每条颈内动脉发出一条大脑中动脉，供应大脑侧面区域，以及一条大脑前动脉，向内侧延伸，然后向上延伸。每条大脑前动脉供应同侧半球的内侧区域，从额极到顶枕沟。

大脑前动脉闭塞会影响对侧腿和脚的感觉和运动功能，同时主要保留对侧手臂/面部（皮质小人）。如果额叶排尿中枢（例如，内侧额叶/扣带回）受到影响，对侧大脑前动脉闭塞的患者也可能出现明显的行为症状（例如，意志缺失）和尿失禁。

（选项B、C、D和E）大脑中动脉闭塞会影响手部（例如，抓握）、面部/口部（例如，吹口哨）和喉咙（例如，吞咽）的运动控制，而对腿部的影响不成比例。它还可能导致Broca失语症（由于优势额叶受损）、对侧的失认症和空间忽略症（由于非优势顶叶受损）、同侧卒中方向的共轭凝视偏斜以及对侧同侧偏盲（由于皮质下颞顶叶的视辐射受损）。

教育目标：大脑前动脉供应两个半球的内侧部分（额叶和顶叶）。闭塞可导致对侧下肢的运动和感觉障碍、行为改变和尿失禁。

summary.en: A patient with carotid artery stenosis experiences embolization during stenting, affecting the anterior cerebral artery. This is most likely to impair climbing stairs due to its impact on motor function of the contralateral leg and foot. Occlusion of the anterior cerebral artery can also lead to behavioral changes and urinary incontinence.
summary.zh: 颈动脉狭窄患者在支架置入术期间发生栓塞，影响大脑前动脉。这最有可能损害爬楼梯的能力，因为它会影响对侧腿和脚的运动功能。大脑前动脉闭塞还可导致行为改变和尿失禁。
